description:
To setup the docking, the Lamarckian genetic algorithm (LGA) was used, and docked conformations were compared and clustered based on the conformational similarities and root-mean-square positional deviation (rmsd).  The numbers of runs were adjusted to 30 for all ligands. Rmsd was calculated based on rmsd conformational clustering tolerance of 2.0 Å. For genetic algorithms, parameters were setup as 150, 0.02, 0.8, 27000, and 2500000 for population size, mutation rate, crossover rate, maximum number of generation, and maximum number of energy evaluations, respectively. For LGA docking, the pseudo-Solis and Wets local search method was used with a maximum of 300 iterations per local search, and the probability of performing local search on an individual in the population was adjusted to 0.06, the size of local search space to sample, ρ, was 1.0, the maximum number of consecutive successes or failures before doubling or halving the ρ was four for both, and finally the lower bound on ρ was 0.01. 

 

To have access to sample data and configuration files also check out: doi: 10.13140/RG.2.2.20407.42403
before_start:
Install all required software:

 

MGL tools 4.2

UCSF Chimera

 Accelrys Discovery Studio

Open babel

Cygwin

ChemSketch

SPDV Swiss PDBVIEWER
manuscript_citation: Kaboli, P. J.; Bazrafkan, M.; Ismail, P.; Ling, K. H. Molecular Modelling of Berberine Derivatives as Inhibitors of Human Smoothened Receptor and Hedgehog Signalling Pathway Using a Newly Developed Algorithm on Anti-Cancer Drugs. Recent Pat. Anticancer. Drug Discov. 2017, 12 (4), 384–400.
guidelines: For each target, you need a separate folder in which you have folders of compounds (ligands). For each ligand, separate docking algorithm should be run.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Each compound should have pdb extension. So using Open babel you need to convert the files from mol, sdf, etc to pdb.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Each compound should have pdb extension. So using Open babel you need to convert the files from mol, sdf, etc to pdb.

components.data:
Download your target from protein data bank.

 

For example: 4jkv

 

Search pdb for 4jkv, and then download 4jkv.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Download your target from protein data bank.

 

For example: 4jkv

 

Search pdb for 4jkv, and then download 4jkv.
Open protein pdb file.

components.data:
Delet all HETATM lines we are refered to the previous dockied ligand.

 

The last line should be END. Edeit all HETAM till you have END after the last ATOM (Which refered the last atom of the last residue).

source_data.description: Open SPDBV
Open your protein.pdb (edited version).
Using the top menu select All.

components.data: Using Prefs at the top menu, click on Energy Minimization, and click OK.
components.name: Description

Save
Open protein.pdb in notpad++

components.data: Delet all coordinates related to SPDBV till END.
components.name: Description

Save

components.data: Copy the last protein pdb file into all folders of your compounds.
components.name: Description

Open AutoDock 4.2

components.data: From the top menu (Read Molecule), go to the first folder and choose your protein to open it in AutoDock.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: From the top menu (Read Molecule), go to the first folder and choose your protein to open it in AutoDock.

EDIT/HYDROGEN/ADD/PPLAR ONLY

 

Click OK.
EDIT/CHARGES/ADD KOLLMAN CHARGES
EDIT/ATOMS/ASSIGN AD4 TYPE

components.data:
SAVE/WRITE PDBQT

 

BROWSE and go to your first folder of which you already read the molecule.

 

Save the pdbqt file so that the file name is as the same as your pdb file.

 

Now select from ATOM to END and ADD

 

Check box for SORT NODES

Check box for SAVE TRANSFORMING COODS

 

OK

source_data.annotation: If your pdb file is 4jkv.pdb, your pdbqt file should be 4jkv.pdbqt.
source_data.thread_text: If your pdb file is 4jkv.pdb, your pdbqt file should be 4jkv.pdbqt.
source_data.body: If your pdb file is 4jkv.pdb, your pdbqt file should be 4jkv.pdbqt.
Later on, carefully save your files in your previous folder (project). If you mistakenly save some files in other folders, you will definitely get error during your run.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 26 of Molecular Docking - An easy protocol
source_data.annotation:
You must already determine where you want to dock and identify the docking site or active site of your target.

For example:

 

For 4jkv, these are suggested:

X= -20.101

Y= 21.355

Z= 28.384

OPEN CYGWIN TERMINAL
You must go to your folder.

source_data.body:
you must already have two exe files in your folders. Copy autogrid4.exe and autodock4.exe to alll ligand folders.
To have these files, go the the link located at the end of abstract of this protocol. A sample data contain one studied docking project in which you can find exe files as well.

components.data: You can see the binding energy calculations and inhibition constants.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: You can see the binding energy calculations and inhibition constants.

components.data: Now you can open your docked files (target_run.pdb) by UCSF Chimera and Accelrys DS, and analyze the interaction between protein and ligand. You can also use LigPlus.
components.name: Description
